intro: Poa dioica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved meadowgrass, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit with narrow, bluish-green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and along stream banks. Poa dioica is an important component of grassland ecosystems and serves as a food source for various herbivores.
